lead_paragraph: Experts on financial distress told lawmakers in Washington that Puerto Rico’s financial troubles are so complex that bankruptcy alone would not solve them, and might make them worse.

headline.print_headline: A Warning on Bankruptcy in Puerto Rico’s Debt Crisis
headline.main: A Warning on Bankruptcy in Puerto Rico’s Debt Crisis

snippet: Experts on financial distress told lawmakers in Washington that Puerto Rico’s financial troubles are so complex that bankruptcy alone would not solve them, and might make them worse.
abstract: Financial distress experts testify before House Subcommittee on Indian, Insular and Alaska Native Affairs that bankruptcy will not solve all of Puerto Rico's financial problems, and could possibly make them worse; experts recommend federal control board, citing Detroit's municipal bankruptcy as evidence for their assertion, given that city reduced its debts but has no recovery plan.
